page.title: 06Birds of Chalfont St.Peter.
page.content: In our study of {ecology} is Chalfont St.Peter I found the following facts about birds area.The {bird} life is large and varied. It ranges from the robin to magpie.The most common birds are the starlings and blackbirds. In the garden behind ours lives a family of magpies in their spherical shaped {nest}.The most colourful bird is the bright red chested bullfinch. Birds in this area seem very bold.I've stood one foot from a {bird} without it flying away.Maybe this is a bad thing because of cars and cats.I questioned twenty families about birds in their gardens. 40% said they fed the birds. Bread and left overs were the most common foods. 40% said they had bird tables.25% said they had nesting boxes,the average eggs were eight and the common bird to nest was the blue tit.
